meanings.def: being the total amount of something before anything is taken away
examples: gross weight (= including the container or wrapping)
gross income/wage (= before taxes, etc. are taken away)
Investments showed a gross profit of 26 per cent.
The family have three children and a gross income of £50 000.
a gross violation of human rights
She could smell his foul breath.
She's not just fat, she's positively gross!

meanings.def: in total, before anything is taken away
to earn a particular amount of money before tax has been taken off it
examples: It is one of the biggest grossing movies of all time.
The concert grossed a massive £2 million at the box office.
to sell something by the gross

meanings.def: a total amount of money earned by something, especially a film, before any costs are taken away
